thread.title: Wayback Wednesday: Watch The First Ever Trailer For Arrow
thread.title_full: Wayback Wednesday: Watch The First Ever Trailer For Arrow

author: Charlie Ridgely
title: Wayback Wednesday: Watch The First Ever Trailer For Arrow
text:
Wayback Wednesday: Watch The First Ever Trailer For Arrow Charlie Ridgely Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
Now in its fifth season, The CW's Arrow has become a superhero TV staple among comic book fans. The series brought the Green Arrow to life, and kicked off the entire Arrow-verse that we know today. 
Five years ago, the hype around the show was building, but no one knew exactly what to expect. Come to find out, the show was a massive hit, and it's become a part of our Wednesday night rituals. 
In honor of Wayback Wednesday - and a brand new episode of Arrow tonight - it's about time to take a look back at the first ever trailer for Arrow . 
This footage was seen in 2012, and it talked a lot about Oliver Queen's return to the real world, after he was thought to be dead. The trailer shows Oliver on the island, beard and all, as well as his assimilation back into society. 
Arrow , The Flash , and all of the other DC TV shows have come a long way since this first trailer, but it's always nice to remember one's roots. 
The new Arrow episode is titled 'Second Chances', and airs tonight on The CW. 
TALIA AL GHUL TAKES OLIVER UNDER HER WING — In his quest to take down Kovar, Oliver ( Stephen Amell ) gets help from a surprising source – Talia al Ghul (guest star Lexa Doig). However, when she reveals what she wants from him in exchange, Oliver isn’t sure he can accept her help. Felicity (Emily Bett Rickards) attempts to hack the NSA to help free Diggle (David Ramsey) but when her online efforts are flagged, she faces off against an unknown adversary. Meanwhile, Curtis (Echo Kellum) tells the team about a female vigilante, Tina Boland (guest star Juliana Harkavay), he uncovered online who has been wreaking havoc all over the country. Mark Bunting directed the episode written by Speed Weed & Sarah Tarkoff (#511). Original airdate 2/1/2017.
